p: Temperature has multiple pathways through which it can influence dengue risk. In general, an increase in temperature shortens the development intervals of immature stages of mosquitoes, increases the biting rates of adults and shortens the extrinsic incubation period of pathogens [ 51]. It is also expected to encourage the adoption of behavioral practices in humans that enhance human-vector contact such as staying outdoors for long periods or leaving their residencesâ€™ windows open while inside [ 47].
